item.title: Controlled Neural ODE
item.description:
In this repo I showcase a simple application of Controlled Neural ODEs as a surrogate model of a physical system. In this case, it is the Forced-and-Damped Simple Harmonic Oscillator.

A brief recap on Neural ODEs:

A Controlled ODE describes the rate of change of a state (vector) as:

$$ dy = f(y, t, u) \ dt $$

where $f(y, t, u)$ is a function that takes in state $y$, time $t$, and non-state variables $u$. In this case, $u$ are external controls. A Neural ODE replaces analytic function $f$ with a neural network $f_{NN}$ either partially, or entirely. A Neural ODE can be interpretted as the continuos analog of a Residual Neural Network.
